page.title: 02SETTLEMENT OF WHITWORTH
page.content: In earliest times Whitworth lay south of the great{Forest of {Rossendale,}and{in Domesday}was part of an area of{high moorland and low {woodland, with villages in the {clearings and no towns at all.}Of the existance of the actual settlements of Whitworth at the time there is some doubt. {Tudor times}saw the forest cleared to open the land and surrounding moors for{sheep farming.}People settled in villages to{weave.}1755 saw the building of a{turnpike road}by Act of Parliament and this opened the way for a great expansion in the industries of the area.{Quarrying}of the millstone grit,{coal mining and yarn manufacture all brought, in the wake of the{ {Industrial Revolution,}people to the valley looking for work.{1901}saw the {largest population for Whitworth;9,574
